lead_paragraph: MOORHEAD--Lucy Galpin, a prominent political hostess in Washington, D.C. and wife of Pennsylvania Congressman William Moorhead, died at age 90 in Westwood, Massachusetts after a brief illness. She was an accomplished writer, painter and equestrian. She was born in 1926 in New York City and grew up in Pelham Manor, New York. Lucy was educated at the Shipley School in Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania, and at Vassar College (B.A. 1946). She was an astute observer of the social and political scenes in Washington, D.C. She wrote Entertaining in Washington (G.P. Putnam's, 1978) and later Dolly Appleton: A Washington Novel (2004), and a memoir, In the Town and in the Country: Washington and Virginia (2004). Her papers are archived with the Schlesinger Library at the Radcliffe Institute of Advanced Study at Harvard University. Lucy is survived by four children: William Moorhead of Madison, Connecticut, Perrin "Penny" Grayson of Boston, Massachusetts, Stephen Moorhead of Dedham, Massachusetts and James Moorhead of Chevy Chase, Maryland and her ten grandchildren and by her beloved standard poodle, Teddy. A service will be held Saturday, March 19th at 11am at St. Paul's Episcopal Church, 59 Court Street, Dedham, MA 02026. Contributions in her honor may be made to the National Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C. (mailing address 200B South Club Drive, Landover, MD 20785) and Vassar College, 124 Raymond Avenue, Poughkeepsie, NY 12604. 1/3
